TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UnregisterAssembly extends Microsoft.Build.Tasks.AppDomainIsolatedTaskExtension

Docs.summary: Implements the `UnregisterAssembly` task. Use the `UnregisterAssembly` element in your project file to create and execute this task. For usage and parameter information, see [UnregisterAssembly Task](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Framework64/\<version>/UnRegisterAssemblyTask cannot resolve a library of COM objects registered as 32-bit components. Framework/\<version>/UnRegisterAssemblyTask cannot resolve a library of COM objects registered as 64-bit components.
For example, if you register a library of COM objects called ClassLibrary1 as 32-bit components on a 64-bit machine, run Visual Studio, and change the target to x64, the build fails with the following error:
`ClassLibrary1.dll is not a valid assembly`

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the assemblies to be unregistered.

Gets or sets information about the state between the `RegisterAssembly` task and the `UnregisterAssembly` task that the `UnregisterAssembly` task uses to avoid unregistering an assembly that failed to register in the `RegisterAssembly` task.
Docs.value: Information about the state between the `RegisterAssembly` task and the `UnregisterAssembly` task.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property is specified, the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.UnregisterAssembly.Assemblies%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.UnregisterAssembly.TypeLibFiles%2A> properties are ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Execute() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether to unregister the specified type library from the specified assembly.
Docs.value: if the `UnregisterAssembly` task should unregister the specified type library from the specified assembly; otherwise, .
